body: DON'T FEED THIS TO ANYTHING, EVER. I ordered this on the advice of my (now former) vet when we learned that our previous food (Taste of the Wild) was the recipient of dozens of lawsuits due to their ingredients causing a fatal heart condition. Come to find out Science Diet has even more lawsuits currently in play for hundreds of pet fatalities... and also that my vet is a vendor for SD. This stuff is lethal- a google search will literally turn up HUNDREDS of cases of pet death, all directly attributable to Science Diet. Don't feed your pets this crap, it's toxic. I won't even leave this out for the critters on my mountain- straight into the burn pile.

body: They changed the formula!!!! They changed the formula! My 4 year old lab has been on this dog food for over 2 years with no issues. His last bag was delivered in Aug and he was sick for weeks before we determined it was the dog food. He started with explosive diarrhea which then turned into throwing up large amounts of food every 3 to 5 days. We had an entire blood panel and x rays done at the vets thinking he ate something and all tests came back normal. It wasn't until I stopped feeding him the dog food and switched him to something else that he stopped throwing up. I saw reviews that the formula had changed and stopped feeding it to my dog immediately and he is 💯 back to normal. I will never feed my dog this dog food ever again!!!
subject: Hill's Science Diet Dry Dog Food, Adult, Large Breed, Chicken & Barley Recipe

body: Something wrong with this one I usually buy this from PetSmart and my dog has been fine with it. She's a picky eater so sometimes we switch up the flavour between this chicken and the lamb one. When I received this bag from the Amazon subscription, all of a sudden, my dog doesn't want to eat the food anymore. Not just picky eating; she legitimately went a whole day not eating because of this food. And even then, she'll only eat a few bites and then leave it. We had to switch it to get her to eat. I don't know if Hill's changed the recipe or Amazon gave me an expired bag or something else is wrong with this particular bag of food, but she does not want it. When we give her other food, she's happy to eat it all; but not this one.

body: Convienent and what my Veternarian recommends My dog loves her food, Hill Science Diet. Buying it online not only is convenient but helps my back!  I prefer buying a large bag because if you are feeding a large breed active dog, they eat quite a bit and you go through food faster than a medium or small dog. When she was a bit underweight the Vet. said, "You can start upping her food to 3.5 cups now, I laughed and said, " She has been eating 5 cups a day now for over a year and I'm just not going to give her any more than that!"  The Vet looked surprised and said, "Wow." My dog is now almost 6, still active, and still eating approx. 5 cups a day and at her optimum weight.Thanks Amazon for making it easy to keep her fed.

body: Best dry food for my dogs I have found I have tried other, costly dog foods in the last couple of years. My oldest pup has cancer, and I’m doing everything I can to find him the highest quality dog food to both keep him happy in the time he has left, and as healthy as possible. That said, I have two others (all three are rescues) and their health and happiness is just as important to me.Let me say this, and I hope you hear me: Blue Buffalo makes all three of my dogs sick! From their food and their treats, my dogs had it coming out both ends within 24 hours of eating their products. Now, as I said, I had  been shopping around, looking for the best food I could afford that I could feed to all of them. Science Diet has won, hands down!All three of my dogs love the taste. They seem to have better energy, better muscle, and a better skin/coat on this food than any other food I have tried. I highly recommend this brand and specifically this product to anyone with a dog. It is pricier than others on the market, but it’s my opinion that it is well worth it. Here’s why:When I was feeding them the cheaper dry food, like Old Roy, Purina etc, the dogs ate the full 4 cups I put out for them and still acted hungry. They had bad dandruff and hot spots, and their shedding was out of control.Once I put them on Science Diet, they only eat half of what I give them and are content and they are actually healthier.So I’m buying half the amount a month I was buying before switching. It actually ends up being cheaper. Hope this helped
subject: Hill's Science Diet Dry Dog Food, Adult, Large Breed, Chicken & Barley Recipe

body: Our Dogs Liked Hill's Chicken and Barley Recipe Hill's Science Diet chicken and barley recipe garnered overall positive "reviews" from our dogs.Our pit bull Nolan, who will eat most anything voraciously, loved this food and scarfed it down as he does most things.  Unlike many brands of dog food, he did not have any problems with gas in the hours after consuming the food.Our overweight, elderly beagle Todd, who always greets any new thing with skepticism, eyeballed the food before tentatively taking a bite. He then gobbled up the rest of it, with no later gas issues.Our nervous mutt Calvin, the most finicky of the group, had no problem eating this food; he did not even give it a suspicious look, as he usually does with new things.Our boys liked the food, and it did appear to be of very good quality, thus we were pleased to feed it to them.I was also pleased with the easy-to-open packaging, which saved some wear-and-tear on my hands!  Less pleasing was the price of Hill's Science Diet products in general, though I found Amazon's pricing to be competitive with the big-box pet stores in my area.Based on my boys' "review" and my own impression of this food, I recommend this chicken and barley recipe from Hill's Science Diet!
subject: Hill's Science Diet Dry Dog Food, Adult, Large Breed, Chicken & Barley Recipe
